meanings.definition: Involving a high price or expense.
meanings.sent1: Buying a new car can be very costly.
meanings.sent2: The designer handbag was too costly for me to afford.
meanings.sent3: I learned the hard way that eating out every day is quite costly.
meanings.sent4: Her mistake proved to be a costly decision in the long run.
meanings.sent5: The repairs on the old house turned out to be more costly than expected.

meanings.definition: Requiring a significant sacrifice or loss.
meanings.sent1: Losing the championship game was a costly defeat for the team.
meanings.sent2: The risky investment turned out to be quite costly for the company.
meanings.sent3: His stubbornness in negotiations proved to be a costly mistake.
meanings.sent4: The delay in starting the project was a costly error in judgment.
meanings.sent5: The decision to skip practice was a costly choice for the athlete.
